Hi Jim,

 

The 690,000 seems right, but the other number could be as well. The main
thing I remember was that there was a lot of non-fittings related stuff that
made it a bit too far removed for any but a totally dedicated fittings
person. I almost expected you to have made the plunge. I rather doubt if
they sold very many of those. On a sort of related note, the big Masamune
and his school book, which has a list price of over 100,000 yen is selling
for 40,000 and I got mine for 38,000. I wish I had known about the big book
sell off at the museum, but I already bought most of what I wanted for full
price earlier on.

 

Gordon

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Jim Gilbert [mailto:jggilbert@...] 
Sent: Tuesday, January 13, 2004 10:31 AM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tsuba designs?

 

I don't remember Matt.  My impression is that it was a lot more than one
would normally expect 8 big, glossy, expensive Japanese fittings books to
be.  Thinking about it I can picture a fittings museum book shelf price card
of Y960,000 or 690,000, but I wouldn't bet on it.  Maybe Alan or Craig knows
what they go for these days.  The fittings museum was offering some
significant discounts for cash book purchases toward the end.

Jim 



  How much was it ....... out of interest?

  - Matt
